commit_message:
Adding Job Binaries support to CLI

Adding Job Binaries commands to Sahara
OpenstackClient plugin:

$ dataprocessing job binary create
$ dataprocessing job binary list
$ dataprocessing job binary show
$ dataprocessing job binary update
$ dataprocessing job binary delete
$ dataprocessing job binary download

Partially implements: blueprint cli-as-openstackclient-plugin

Change-Id: Ia452b22ac27677a911b5b2f38a0250d4962be447

commit_message:
Changes cursor to hand/grab in network topology.

The network topology view can get rather large and off screen.
When it gets off screen, there is no scroll bars but instead you
can grab the topology and move it around like a map. This ability
is not very clear/intuitive with the default/arrow cursor. This
patch changes the cursor in the topology view to a hand grab cursor
to make this ability more obvious and intuitive.

Closes-Bug: #1503028

Change-Id: I4cc50b4881642e57605fea86a522cd88f1cb7d48

commit_message:
grenade-multinode: parity with ncpu jobs

We now have fixes that demonstrate the multinode grenade tests working
reasonably well. Our end game is replacing the partial-ncpu job. We
should run this non-voting job everywhere that the partial-ncpu is to
build up enough data to feel comfortable with the voting and flipping
to this job.

Depends-On: I5c899779866ebdf492d474a625eb396273bb0259

Change-Id: I4eefa772b5c9e95608a1ff4e49fc5af60bd0b1a4

commit_message:
Remove SoftDeleteMixin from NovaBase

The mixin is re-added to every class that currently inherits from
NovaBase, so there is no impact to existing classes.

The advantage is that new tables which inherit from NovaBase will not
get the mixin and won't need to have the columns for soft deletion. It
also opens the door to gradually removing the SoftDeleteMixin on a
case-by-case basis.

bp no-more-soft-delete

Change-Id: Id6b37f9a375b383f689f0e23abca7106c9872596

commit_message:
Clarify with example mentioning gratuitous whitespace changes

Maybe I'm just too picky but I usually call this stuff out in reviews
even if I decide to +2 the patch set.

Change-Id: I5a2667d44203147e112f5a1d7573105478d805f7

revisions:

commit_message:
[install] Workaround for RDO lacking PyMySQL

Upstream uses the PyMySQL library in Liberty, but RDO
does not provide a package for it. Installations using
RDO packages must revert to the python-MySQL library
for any service that uses an SQL database which requires
changing the database connection string from
'mysql+pymysql://' to 'mysql://'.

As a workaround, this patch adds conditionals for each
SQL database connection string. After merging, we can
publish the RDO version of the installation guide.

Change-Id: If2423fcfbc08d028d35731aee2896a5bd45c2fb4
Implements: bp installguide-liberty
Closes-Bug: #1501991

commit_message:
Adds skeleton to failures page, ui routes for timeline (WIP)

This adds the controller and state for the in-progress failures page.
Page will be expanded to detail all failing tests from a run, along
with pertient log information such as tracebacks.

Change-Id: I1b78c5f7991530b944882158d7433edac00ed7e9

commit_message:
Rebase on pypowervm slot_number => lpar_slot_num

Recently pypowervm refactored and expanded the slot number and LPAR ID
properties on virtual storage adapters such that
{vios|lpar}_{id|slot_num} always refers to the ID or slot number on the
VIOS or LPAR, respectively, regardless of whether you're looking at the
client or server side of the adapter.  (Change-Id:
Id626a1b23b9b2757e5e1f38fd6ed141d97fd0e74)

The only non-backward-compatible change is the renaming of slot_number
to lpar_slot_num.  This change set rebases on that modification.

Change-Id: I2d392781817b076b79cf93360588c6107dceaca4

commit_message:
Rebase on pypowervm slot_number => lpar_slot_num

Recently pypowervm refactored and expanded the slot number and LPAR ID
properties on virtual storage adapters such that
{vios|lpar}_{id|slot_num} always refers to the ID or slot number on the
VIOS or LPAR, respectively, regardless of whether you're looking at the
client or server side of the adapter.  (Change-Id:
Id626a1b23b9b2757e5e1f38fd6ed141d97fd0e74)

The only non-backward-compatible change is the renaming of slot_number
to lpar_slot_num.  This change set rebases on that modification.

Change-Id: I2d392781817b076b79cf93360588c6107dceaca4

commit_message:
Asynchronous PowerOn (spawn, rescue, unrescue)

The nova driver polls the VM state once spawn/rescue/unrescue has
completed.  It's double-duty to have those methods wait for the PowerOn
Job to complete before returning.  This change set takes advantage of
the asynchronous option on the pypowervm power_on task to allow these
methods to return as soon as the PowerOn Job has started.

Change-Id: I6c1acd172f49a7d4ec39845231a0c67329e82c11
(cherry picked from commit 39b643cbcd1ab38938d6264bf6c409491d42998a)

subject: [install] Workaround for RDO lacking PyMySQL
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-10-29 19:55:12.000000000', 'files': ['doc/install-guide/source/neutron-controller-install-option1.rst', 'doc/install-guide/source/keystone-install.rst', 'doc/install-guide/source/nova-controller-install.rst', 'doc/install-guide/source/cinder-storage-install.rst', 'doc/install-guide/source/heat-install.rst', 'doc/install-guide/source/cinder-controller-install.rst', 'doc/install-guide/source/glance-install.rst', 'doc/install-guide/source/neutron-controller-install-option2.rst'], 'message': "[install] Workaround for RDO lacking PyMySQL

Upstream uses the PyMySQL library in Liberty, but RDO
does not provide a package for it. Installations using
RDO packages must revert to the python-MySQL library
for any service that uses an SQL database which requires
changing the database connection string from
'mysql+pymysql://' to 'mysql://'.

As a workaround, this patch adds conditionals for each
SQL database connection string. After merging, we can
publish the RDO version of the installation guide.

Change-Id: I09694c4e95643b7ad7a2a05fabf90476b01f9860
Implements: bp installguide-liberty
Closes-Bug: #1501991
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
[install] Workaround for RDO lacking PyMySQL

Upstream uses the PyMySQL library in Liberty, but RDO
does not provide a package for it. Installations using
RDO packages must revert to the python-MySQL library
for any service that uses an SQL database which requires
changing the database connection string from
'mysql+pymysql://' to 'mysql://'.

As a workaround, this patch adds conditionals for each
SQL database connection string. After merging, we can
publish the RDO version of the installation guide.

Change-Id: I09694c4e95643b7ad7a2a05fabf90476b01f9860
Implements: bp installguide-liberty
Closes-Bug: #1501991

Guru Meditation Reports (GMR) code in oslo.reports was recently updated
to expect SIGUSR2 as opposed to SIGUSR1, because it is reserved by
Apache 'mod_wsgi' for its own use.

So, update the Nova doc, gmr.rst, to reflect this new reality.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/223133/ -- guru_meditation_report:
    Use SIGUSR2 instead of SIGUSR1

Change-Id: Iac2d606103189b965581e0c6c20b55360a04e3a6
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
doc: gmr: Update instructions to generate GMR error reports

Guru Meditation Reports (GMR) code in oslo.reports was recently updated
to expect SIGUSR2 as opposed to SIGUSR1, because it is reserved by
Apache 'mod_wsgi' for its own use.

So, update the Nova doc, gmr.rst, to reflect this new reality.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/223133/ -- guru_meditation_report:
    Use SIGUSR2 instead of SIGUSR1

Change-Id: Iac2d606103189b965581e0c6c20b55360a04e3a6

commit_message:
Asynchronous PowerOn (spawn, rescue, unrescue)

The nova driver polls the VM state once spawn/rescue/unrescue has
completed.  It's double-duty to have those methods wait for the PowerOn
Job to complete before returning.  This change set takes advantage of
the asynchronous option on the pypowervm power_on task to allow these
methods to return as soon as the PowerOn Job has started.

Change-Id: I6c1acd172f49a7d4ec39845231a0c67329e82c11

', 'number': 4}, {'created': '2015-06-11 17:21:16.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'No more soft delete

There was widespread agreement at the YVR summit not to soft-delete
any more things. To remove the temptation, while cleaning up the
codebase at the same time, we should remove the SoftDeleteMixin from
NovaBase and only apply it to those models which are both soft-deleted
at some point and which are queried for deleted rows.

This means that this spec should only remove columns that Nova will not
miss. Operators will be asked to feed back on whether any of these
columns are critical to them, those which are will not be removed until
a deprecation cycle has passed.

Although this spec describes a monolithic change, implementing this in a
single review would be ambitious. The first review will remove
SoftDeleteMixin from NovaBase and reapply it everywhere. The next review
will remove it from a single candidate and so on. Once some confidence
is gained, they may be reviewed in small bundles.

blueprint no-more-soft-delete

Change-Id: If9200823f472fd3e9c32a8e61f235539ec7de8a5

any more things. To remove the temptation, while cleaning up the

NovaBase and only apply it to those models which are both soft-deleted
at some point and which are queried for deleted rows.

This means that this spec should only remove columns that Nova will not
miss. Operators will be asked to feed back on whether any of these
columns are critical to them, those which are will not be removed until
a deprecation cycle has passed.

Although this spec describes a monolithic change, implementing this in a
single review would be ambitious. The first review will remove
SoftDeleteMixin from NovaBase and reapply it everywhere. The next review
will remove it from a single candidate and so on. Once some confidence
is gained, they may be reviewed in small bundles.

blueprint no-more-soft-delete

Change-Id: If9200823f472fd3e9c32a8e61f235539ec7de8a5

commit_message:
No more soft delete

There was widespread agreement at the YVR summit not to soft-delete
any more things. To codify this, we should remove the SoftDeleteMixin
from NovaBase.

blueprint no-more-soft-delete

Change-Id: If9200823f472fd3e9c32a8e61f235539ec7de8a5

commit_message:
[install] Liberty updates for heat

More heat configuration updates for Liberty, primarily
clarifying the extra information in the Identity service
necessary for heat operation and implementing new (lacking
documentation) configuration for Identity service access.

Change-Id: I6e4a7c182a9f9608702607995c2314dca8c4b7fa
Implements: bp installguide-liberty

commit_message:
Update CLI reference for python-novaclient 2.33.0

The number of commands is not changed.
But ten commands order is changed.
  migration-list
  instance-action
  instance-action-list
  host-meta
  host-servers-migrate
  list-extensions
  cell-capacities
  cell-show
  host-evacuate
  host-evacuate-live

Closes-Bug: #1507851
Change-Id: Ib888b755cfcb71c4f5c0537d76e7b4cf8baaab54

commit_message:
Adding Jobs support to CLI

Adding Jobs commands to Sahara OpenstackClient
plugin:

$ dataprocessing job execute
$ dataprocessing job list
$ dataprocessing job show
$ dataprocessing job update
$ dataprocessing job delete

Partially implements: blueprint cli-as-openstackclient-plugin

Change-Id: I00cdd80740a0052d4e562276f8225378c7e8de55

commit_message:
WIP: DynamicActionList directive for dynamic actions

Actions are sensitive to user permissions
and are available based on context.
This directive allows for dynamically composing menu
actions based on how many actions are provided.

Change-Id: I4a70e141b8d3d919efd5f3ae7902d7e781a50f91
Partially-Implements: blueprint angularize-images-table

commit_message:
Get default case priority from project config

Remove hardcoded default test case priority and
use TestRail API client to get ID of current
default priority.

Change-Id: I9921e01734405acaad39e8e2a20360f7c047d652
Closes-bug: #1511317

commit_message:
Get default case priority from project config

Remove hardcoded default test case priority and
use TestRail API client to get ID of current
default priority.

Change-Id: I9921e01734405acaad39e8e2a20360f7c047d652
Closes-bug: #1511317

commit_message:
Revert "Don't use retries for puppet deployments by default"

Instead of just setup zero retries we should give ability to
changing this parameter explicitly using web interface or fuel
cli

Related-Bug: #1510912
This reverts commit c145db34762532bf95a1d493db8e00c95db9bc67.

Change-Id: I8d3b98d66df19f070f6b06134869248a7c3d45fc

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-10-26 16:13:13.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Fix no-share-servers CI job

Our Tempest job "*no-share-servers*" fails after merge of change [1]

The root cause for it is in changed behaviour:
After merge of change [1] share services with driver that use Nova
started verify availability of a Nova VM by its net interface and
do not report its capabilities until it is available.
It takes about 2,5 minutes. During this time scheduler has no available
hosts and we get "no hosts available" errors from it in case of CI that
runs Tempest tests much faster than 2,5 minutes after VM creation.

So, add waiter in post_test_hook.sh script.

[1] I325d6461c4b12f481769bb01f792ef850dba789c

Change-Id: I58d617dd76cf079e5e26bf6a4ddc6b4fba4e20e6
Closes-Bug: #1507605

commit_message:
Fix no-share-servers CI job

Our Tempest job "*no-share-servers*" fails after merge of change [1]

The root cause for it is in changed behaviour:
After merge of change [1] share services with driver that use Nova
started verify availability of a Nova VM by its net interface and
do not report its capabilities until it is available.
It takes about 2,5 minutes. During this time scheduler has no available
hosts and we get "no hosts available" errors from it in case of CI that
runs Tempest tests much faster than 2,5 minutes after VM creation.

So, add waiter in post_test_hook.sh script.

[1] I325d6461c4b12f481769bb01f792ef850dba789c

Change-Id: I58d617dd76cf079e5e26bf6a4ddc6b4fba4e20e6
Closes-Bug: #1507605

commit_message:
Use assertTrue/False instead of assertEqual(T/F)

The usage of assertEqual(True/False, ***) should be changed to a more
meaningful format of assertTrue/False(***).

Closes-Bug: #1510001

commit_message:
[Ironic] Add ironic conductor and compute

This change introduces new node role for Ironic.

On nodes with ironic role should works following services:
* ironic-conductor
* nova-compute with ironic compute_driver
* tftp server

Partially Implements: blueprint fuel-integrate-ironic
Change-Id: I448bbf5d77723003894373bdd917ea99d58b87fd

subject: Handle additional server options in ntp.conf
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-10-28 01:30:46.000000000', 'files': ['monasca_setup/detection/plugins/ntp.py'], 'message': 'Handle additional server options in ntp.conf

ntpd allows additional options on the server line, for example,
server ntp.example.com iburst
is a valid server line in /etc/ntp.conf. However, the previous code
would set the ntp server as "ntp.example.com iburst" which could not
be resolved

Changed the code to strip off anything on the server line after
the hostname or IP address

Change-Id: I83d9b0bdec14ac81cfd10c495dcb56cf97bff1ab
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Handle additional server options in ntp.conf

ntpd allows additional options on the server line, for example,
server ntp.example.com iburst
is a valid server line in /etc/ntp.conf. However, the previous code
would set the ntp server as "ntp.example.com iburst" which could not
be resolved

Changed the code to strip off anything on the server line after
the hostname or IP address

Change-Id: I83d9b0bdec14ac81cfd10c495dcb56cf97bff1ab

and now we need to build network-checker package using the
source code from this new repo.

subject: libvirt detection plugin adds bad instances
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-10-28 04:17:29.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'libvirt detection plugin adds bad instances

Without this change, running the detection plugin results in
instances being added to /etc/monasca/agent/conf.d/libvirt.yaml that
only contained a built_by value of Libvirt. One instance would be created
for each run of the detection plugin. For example, after two runs of the
detection plugin, this would be at the end of
/etc/monasca/agent/conf.d/libvirt.yaml:

instances:
- built_by: Libvirt
- built_by: Libvirt

Change-Id: Ic1a5a87b4c1c184d1e971edbb56c060dbd2473d7
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2015-10-28 04:25:02.000000000', 'files': ['monasca_setup/detection/plugins/libvirt.py'], 'message': "libvirt detection plugin adds bad instances

Without this change, running the detection plugin results in
instances being added to /etc/monasca/agent/conf.d/libvirt.yaml that
only contained a built_by value of Libvirt. One instance would be created
for each run of the detection plugin. For example, after two runs of the
detection plugin, this would be at the end of
/etc/monasca/agent/conf.d/libvirt.yaml:

instances:
- built_by: Libvirt
- built_by: Libvirt

This doesn't actually cause any real problems with running the
libvirt detection plugin except the agent is restarted every time
the plugin is run even if there are no changes. That is because the
code thinks a new instance is being added so it has to restart the
agent.

Change-Id: Ic1a5a87b4c1c184d1e971edbb56c060dbd2473d7
", 'number': 2}]
commit_message:
libvirt detection plugin adds bad instances

Without this change, running the detection plugin results in
instances being added to /etc/monasca/agent/conf.d/libvirt.yaml that
only contained a built_by value of Libvirt. One instance would be created
for each run of the detection plugin. For example, after two runs of the
detection plugin, this would be at the end of
/etc/monasca/agent/conf.d/libvirt.yaml:

instances:
- built_by: Libvirt
- built_by: Libvirt

This doesn't actually cause any real problems with running the
libvirt detection plugin except the agent is restarted every time
the plugin is run even if there are no changes. That is because the
code thinks a new instance is being added so it has to restart the
agent.

Change-Id: Ic1a5a87b4c1c184d1e971edbb56c060dbd2473d7

Also it is reduces namespace cluttering of dependencies module.

commit_message:
Move sync_point exceptions to common module

It is convenient to have all exceptions in exception module.
Also it is reduces namespace cluttering of sync_point module and decreases
the number of dependencies in other modules.
SyncPointNotFound exception is moved in this patch.

commit_message:
Centralized exceptions

I propose to centralized manage all exceptions in to an
exception folder, and categorize exceptions under exception folder. I Think
this will help us to manage exceptions, easier to find intersection of each
exceptions, and easier to inherit.

Change-Id: Ic18c3c90ed659a74fce9b8801c2b44f46a670dfb

subject: Allow easy neutron lbaas v2 enablement in devstack gates
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-10-19 18:23:46.000000000', 'files': ['devstack-vm-gate.sh', 'devstack-vm-gate-wrap.sh'], 'message': 'Allow easy neutron lbaas v2 enablement in devstack gates

There are other gates looking to go after the new lbaasv2 support
with their devstack integration tests. This patch will make it very
easy to switch to using lbassv2 while still allowing the current
lbaasv1 default.

The new lbaasv2 is not compatible and cannot be enabled with v1.
For projects that need to test with both v1 and v2, separate
devstack gate jobs will be needed.  One gate would have the
DEVSTACK_GATE_NEUTRON_LBAASV2=1 to enable the v2 support.

This is related to the heat lbaas bp
blueprint: lbaasv2-suport

Change-Id: I52c78a21258e7779de6bcb2519b2d94025ca5bd6
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Allow easy neutron lbaas v2 enablement in devstack gates

There are other gates looking to go after the new lbaasv2 support
with their devstack integration tests. This patch will make it very
easy to switch to using lbassv2 while still allowing the current
lbaasv1 default.

The new lbaasv2 is not compatible and cannot be enabled with v1.
For projects that need to test with both v1 and v2, separate
devstack gate jobs will be needed.  One gate would have the
DEVSTACK_GATE_NEUTRON_LBAASV2=1 to enable the v2 support.

This is related to the heat lbaas bp
blueprint: lbaasv2-suport

Change-Id: I52c78a21258e7779de6bcb2519b2d94025ca5bd6

[{'created': '2015-10-23 06:58:16.000000000', 'files': ['spec/classes/aodh_api_spec.rb', 'manifests/api.pp'], 'message': "api: fix default port to bind API service

commit_message:
api: fix default port to bind API service

Due to a wrong copy paste, the default port was 8777 which is already
used by Ceilemeter API service. Let's use the default Aodh: 8042.

This reverts commit 0cd58123be5e2c2bc2f1233a3e15fb35b2ead1a0

This is a backward incompatible change that is blocking our
ability to release 2.34 for 63c7a57, which was a revert for
another backward incompatible change (2961e82) which slipped
into 2.33.

Once we release 2.34 with the bug fixes, we'll revert this

', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Revert "Remove novaclient.v1_1 module"

This reverts commit 0cd58123be5e2c2bc2f1233a3e15fb35b2ead1a0

This is a backward incompatible change that is blocking our
ability to release 2.34 for 63c7a57, which was a revert for
another backward incompatible change (2961e82) which slipped
into 2.33.

Once we release 2.34 with the bug fixes, we'll revert this
revert and release that as novaclient 3.0.

Change-Id: If79d37df3e99004897f1bb2d8564d2f1d8aa0978

commit_message:
Fix `raise` section in docstrings

The correct format is:
    :raises Exception: conditions

This patch fix all docstrings across the project and
add hacking rule to check it.

Change-Id: I40cc20f8d555082e284c1683522932aaa68f575c
Closes-Bug: 1470901

commit_message:
Include allocated quota value in the quota reserve

When we do a quota_reserve in a project, the allocated quota for their
subprojects was not considered in the over quota calculation

Co-Authored-By: Paulo Ewerton <pauloewerton@lsd.ufcg.edu.br>

Change-Id: Ia72e13a40e00c4ec0e986b80a7c9a322f3df659d
Closes-Bug: #1505801

[{'created': '2015-10-23 15:20:30.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Run after creation commands when container is up

Since we run puppet manifests inside containers when we start them, it
seems incorrect to run any *after creation commands* right after
creation and don't wait until they are up. Otherwise we may conflict

Since we run puppet manifests inside containers when we start them, it
seems incorrect to run any *after creation commands* right after

commit_message:
Run after creation commands when container is up

Since we run puppet manifests inside containers when we start them, it
seems incorrect to run any *after creation commands* right after
creation and don't wait until they are up. Otherwise we may conflict
with puppet and fail. So let's use 'dockerctl' to block execution until
containers are up.

Change-Id: Icbaa0786011be30298b708404eb6db32ee3e1597
Closes-Bug: #1506810

commit_message:
Replace release.is_deployable with release.state

is_deployable doesn't really give any additional information for a
release, it is removed. To make change API-backward-compatible, it is
retained as a property dependent on release.state.

New state is added - manageonly, for environments that are not able to
be deployed, but can still be managed.

Change-Id: I518a0114730a2f227c9ef035a376f9a90d3d5bbd
Closes-bug: #1503303
DocImpact

commit_message:
MÐ°ke possible to upgrade Fuel 7.0 to Fuel 8.0

Since we're supporting only one consequent upgrade chain, and current
master is 8.0, let's set 7.0 as previous release and unblock 7.0 -> 8.0
upgrade chain.

Change-Id: I0777ac908af45268760315329d26f4c5ce8c223a
Closes-Bug: #1506380

subject: Remove new supervisor configs during rollback
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 8749, 'name': 'Evgeniy L', 'email': 'eli@mirantis.com', 'username': 'evgeniyl'}, {'_account_id': 8971, 'name': 'Fuel CI', 'username': 'fuel-ci', 'inactive': True, 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10391, 'name': 'Ihor Kalnytskyi', 'email': 'ihor@kalnytskyi.com', 'username': 'ikalnitsky'}, {'_account_id': 12200, 'name': 'Sebastian Kalinowski', 'email': 'sebastian@kalinowski.eu', 'username': 'prmtl'}, {'_account_id': 18205, 'name': 'Bulat Gaifullin', 'email': 'gaifullinbf@gmail.com', 'username': 'bgaifullin'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-10-29 12:09:30.000000000', 'files': ['fuel_upgrade/tests/test_supervisor_client.py', 'fuel_upgrade/tests/test_docker_upgrader.py', 'fuel_upgrade/clients/supervisor_client.py', 'fuel_upgrade/engines/docker_engine.py'], 'message': "Remove new supervisor configs during rollback

We have to clean-up new artifacts in case of rollback and we didn't do
this for new supervisor configs. That's why upgrade fails if there were
some rollback before - we're unable to manage docker containers because
new one are launched automatically when we switched to the new
supervisor folder which is intended to be empty.

Closes-Bug: #1484091

Change-Id: Ic491d04fc3037c748b403fe0964f3fbc8db5769d
Signed-off-by: Igor Kalnitsky <igor@kalnitsky.org>
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Remove new supervisor configs during rollback

We have to clean-up new artifacts in case of rollback and we didn't do
this for new supervisor configs. That's why upgrade fails if there were
some rollback before - we're unable to manage docker containers because
new one are launched automatically when we switched to the new
supervisor folder which is intended to be empty.

Closes-Bug: #1484091

Change-Id: Ic491d04fc3037c748b403fe0964f3fbc8db5769d
Signed-off-by: Igor Kalnitsky <igor@kalnitsky.org>

commit_message:
Check release is_deployable during upgrade notification

This patch adds check for "is_deployable" flag, which skips creating
notifications for releases with is_deployable equal False.

Change-Id: Id8d0ada07fdb1cfc8c37822ec25cb52608002d24
Closes-Bug: #1477958

commit_message:
Remove new auxiliary repo in case of rollback

Since we're managing auxiliary repo in puppet manifests (creating it)
and we don't have any sort of rollback puppet manifest, we need to
clean-up its artifacts in fuel_upgrade script.

This patch removed all newly created auxiliary repo in case of
rollback.

Depends-On: Iec2645ddbee6b1b6b9e5c2816707b275542ef51b
Closes-Bug: #1480282

Change-Id: If34406dd77aed45f19fa2f352bd23a0302716053
Signed-off-by: Igor Kalnitsky <igor@kalnitsky.org>

commit_message:
Change request header in HaProxy configuration for Heat API

Set requests header for Heat API service in HaProxy configuration to
'https' if ssl is used. It will help to avoid the problem with
wrong redirect during getting some info from Heat.

Cherry-picked from master. Conflicts resolved:
	deployment/puppet/openstack/manifests/ha/heat.pp
	tests/noop/spec/hosts/openstack-haproxy/openstack-haproxy-heat_spec.rb

Change-Id: Ie59c83dd6959ec66671de278764eb21d6bee1bb3
Closes-bug: #1486611

Adding node to group from other env is bad request

Validator was tweaked to check if node cluster is the same as node group
cluster.

commit_message:
Fix sahra-dsvm and sahara-mos jobs

The problem is sahara service type is different in MOS and dsvm.
Use api_versions context to set 'data_processing' for MOS and
'data-processig' for dsvm.

Also add missing service type 'data_processing'.

Change-Id: I4c31ec6d2dfa0b4098a0a9a647f052f935df4471

commit_message:
Added workload formulas

Workload formulas specify the concurrency and the number of iterations
for any particular test scenario based on the configuration of open stack
being tested. The first commit contains the initial versions of this
formulas. All of them scale concurrency and number of iterations
proportionally to number of controllers. These formulas need to be revised
and fine-tuned iteratively.

Also added support for basic math functions (min, max, round, ceil)
inside jinja templates.

Change-Id: I956bc3d9ff831b098cc8be3ee55283a567360906

commit_message:
Contributor Guide: Fix markup

`x` is not rendered special in any way and thus not visible. Just use
"x" instead to mark the words.

Change-Id: I51331fd2aa1ed58c55903cd0cd549b62949785c1

tests where necessary.

commit_message:
Check gateways if non-default node groups are used

Add neutron_check_gateways to NetworkCheck class which checks that
valid gateways are specified for all networks if non-default node
groups are used.

Change-Id: I433bc322bbfa2e121fba77ea9802d4a5d3a218ad
Closes-Bug: #1472662

commit_message:
Find bridge information by network role

With network templates there is no guarantee that a bridge
named 'br-mgmt' or 'br-ex' will exist. Another bridge can
satisfy the required network roles however.

Change-Id: I85b7955dc77d0b4f30ef0b07be7d5535698b9c22
Closes-bug: #1498088
(cherry picked from commit 188ee2943fb316be1f295b608de35e7b3cd9c36a)

commit_message:
Add new project rally-ci

Single daemon that listen gerrit or other events, launch tests on
worker nodes, process and publish results.

Powered by python3 and asyncio.
Status monitoring is based on jquery and websockets.

Change-Id: Ic37d573e49383342b0d5f4d8350cd5d695f573ba

commit_message:
Format of nova-api log files was corrected

When nova-api and nova-ec2-api services are started by Apache
(it can be done with devstack config option NOVA_USE_MOD_WSGI=True)
log files contained duplication of timestamp value.

Change-Id: I5439ea8f89ca3073600456f67220e9d3f5257d97
Closes-Bug: #1510517

commit_message:
Initialize for key 'extensions' in the 'options' dict.

Set up 'extensions' value to empty list if one isn't specified (for initialize).

Closes-bug: #1496164

Change-Id: I80b2eab667bafabc48be8e1a7d376eeca590553e

update image in glance, in such conditions tempest test cases fails.

For catering this requirement new flag was introduced in tempest.conf

commit_message:
policy restrain non-admin user image upload

There are some coditions exist where policy restrain the non-admin user to
update image in glance,in such conditions tempest test cases fails.

For catering this requirement new flag was introduced in tempest.conf
'image_upload_allowed' under [image] section. Its default value is true,
but in case non-admin user is not allowed to perform image upload,
value can be set to false, so that test cases are skipped rather
then getting failed.

Change-Id: Ib27e5d6c97e42bb8d2b5ee8807f928003ec73309
Closes-Bug: 1510905

commit_message:
Move endpoint_policy migrations into keystone core

This is the most basic way to move the endpoint_policy migrations into
the keystone core migrations path. Check to see if the migration was
performed already via the extension and if so skip performing it again.

Change-Id: Id1cd0143951a8086803fe739ea5f143adb1ee6ba
Implements: bp move-extensions

commit_message:
Fixed generators support in fuel plugin environment_config.yaml

Fixed attributes processing mechanism in such a way that at the first step
instance editable metadata attributes are merged with plugin attributes and
only after that the resulting attributes dict goes through generator processing

Change-Id: I4bda81f323a3f77ae5ace3927ac5f157503822ee
Closes-bug: #1473452
(cherry picked from commit d8608388bef3ea688886f6f723f8447ec5b7cbef)

commit_message:
Taken into account LACP bond configuration feature

For Ubuntu 14.04, while configuring LACP bonds should be used

     bond-slaves none

instead

     bond-slaves eth1 eth2

Change-Id: Ib98909845794ba1b1ccb0b7f07023e0d2cccd276

commit_message:
Implement some checks for lnx-bond slave interfaces

* put slave interfaces to UP state while bond assembling
* flush any IP addresses from bond slave if exists
* check 'if bond exists' while port setting up

Closes-bug: #1469746

Change-Id: I11fd2177166454e4f3f85670f30bea638adc67f9

commit_message:
Add sysctl call to set values in namespace

Set ip_nonlocal_bind in namespace explicitly to
prevent HAProxy failures at start.


Change-Id: Ibf6b2a737e97002edba2dc074c5ad239d2ef6c10
Closes-Bug: 1500871
Co-Authored-By: <dipatov@mirantis.com>
(cherry picked from commit 4aa596fd94888362e1d77b723b01609e90b5c4ae)

commit_message:
Use separate queue for agent state reports.

This optimization is needed for big clusters with hundreds
of agents where the spike of activity may trigger a burst
of RPC requests that would prevent neutron-server from processing
agent heart beats in time, triggering resource rescheduling.

This will be further optimized by running dedicated RPC workers
for state reports processing.

Related-Bug: #1496410
Change-Id: Id86a1f962aaa4f64011d57ae55d240f890cca4f7

commit_message:
Optimize interface_exists_on_bridge

Currently interface_exists_on_bridge[1] lists all files in a folder and
searchs for the file associated to the interface.

This change proposes to look for the file existence directly.

[1] neutron.plugins.ml2.drivers.linuxbridge.agent.linuxbridge_neutron_agent

Closes-Bug: #1509890
Change-Id: I23cd1edc92912b35bdc23ba0af2318b86f2cfd48

These execution branches call continue directly without
logging the end of the router update.  This leads to

it is a delete or a PD update.

Change-Id: Id82e7374aa9336e0adea3042238f30f716208373
Signed-off-by: Ryan Moats <rmoats@us.ibm.com>
Closes-bug: #1511004

commit_message:
Log end of router updates for PD and delete branches

These execution branches call continue directly without
logging the end of the router update.  This leads to
confusion about when the last router update finishes if
it is a delete or a PD update.

Change-Id: Id82e7374aa9336e0adea3042238f30f716208373
Signed-off-by: Ryan Moats <rmoats@us.ibm.com>

commit_message:
Rm openstack/common/versionutils from setup.cfg

Versionutils graduated a while ago, and Nova was updated to use it in this
patch: Id0e483c662231f678bddff7ddf77cdb0b0e1a5db. This removes a reference
to openstack/common/versionutils that was missed.

Change-Id: I8d289120f99f24663537ffffe816283a98c5e511

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-10-29 08:37:14.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/jobs/infra.yaml', 'test-requirements.txt', 'nodepool/nodepool.yaml', 'zuul/layout.yaml', 'tox.ini'], 'message': "Move nodepool.yaml from system-config to project-config

Nodepool.yaml.erb in system-config no longer contains any secrets.
Let's move it to the project-config repo.

Add the nodepool validation jobs and tox environment, initially
as non-voting until it is boot strapped.

The version of nodepool.yaml proposed matches the version in system-config
depends-on patch. A follow-up patch will be submitted with any deltas needed
when the needed-by patch is ready to merge. Until that happens, this nodepool.yaml
file won't be used and is safe to merge.

Make both gate-project-config-nodepool and gate-system-config-nodepool
non-voting to aid in bootstrapping this change.

The nodepool logging template file and associated tool that generates the file
will remain in system-config. In the short term, updates to nodepool.yaml in
this repo may require a related change in system-config to update the logging
configuration. In the longer term, nodepool will be updated to automatically
log image creations without needing a customized logging configuration.

", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Move nodepool.yaml from system-config to project-config

Nodepool.yaml.erb in system-config no longer contains any secrets.
Let's move it to the project-config repo.

Add the nodepool validation jobs and tox environment, initially
as non-voting until it is boot strapped.

The version of nodepool.yaml proposed matches the version in system-config
depends-on patch. A follow-up patch will be submitted with any deltas needed
when the needed-by patch is ready to merge. Until that happens, this nodepool.yaml
file won't be used and is safe to merge.

Make both gate-project-config-nodepool and gate-system-config-nodepool
non-voting to aid in bootstrapping this change.

The nodepool logging template file and associated tool that generates the file
will remain in system-config. In the short term, updates to nodepool.yaml in
this repo may require a related change in system-config to update the logging
configuration. In the longer term, nodepool will be updated to automatically
log image creations without needing a customized logging configuration.

Change-Id: I96fd99cf3b6a974749b92457423b1867a125b92f
Needed-By: I2b45a7145805368b1598d3a3e8a94f0e4eb8cf2d
Depends-On: Ib045c104daac15360e62f46e3e5683c7a387bc96
Depends-On: I89207d100eb4b6bbb502a6ed38831f49e4b29096

commit_message:
Remove excessive fallback iptables ACCEPT rules

The previous code was generating a fallback ACCEPT rule for every
port when there should only be one at the very end. The reason that
this wasn't causing a bug is because we have a duplicate rule remover
that was silently throwing away the extras and it happened to get them
in the right order.

Closes-Bug: #1502906
Change-Id: I83cf574f93b512be1ccefdc8da63e1783d279233

commit_message:
Removed shared instances for live-migration

Sharing instances at the class level could
cause unwanted side effects and races that would
be hard to debug/fix.

To improve code reliability, removed instance
cache from live-migration test-case.

Closes-bug:#1501040

commit_message:
Update import of oslo.config

    oslo.config module's import changes from 2.0.0
        oslo.config => oslo_config

    Without this fix, Config ref autogeneration is failed in
        import module (No module named error).

Related-Bug: #1503967

Change-Id: I68ed20e4f5b4414f5cab8e4a70234ad356b92afd

commit_message:
libvirt: add debug logging for lxc teardown paths

There are races to setup and teardown lxc-backed instances using nbd
mounts when running tempest which result in mount failing.

This change adds some debug logging to help figure out what's going on
to see where the race is happening.

Related-Bug: #1491563

Change-Id: Ief8edef0df8da1a6ee94aafa9ceaf96da5e3211b

[{'created': '2015-10-28 12:31:57.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/token/provider.py'], 'message': 'WIP: No revocation event for individual tokens with persistence

In a configuration where tokens persist in some store, deleting
a token from the store is enough to revoke the token. We can
and should avoid adding a new revocation event as growing number

Change-Id: I7d53320eccd119b9ab394ddc88473d09c9b680b4
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
WIP: No revocation event for individual tokens with persistence

In a configuration where tokens persist in some store, deleting
a token from the store is enough to revoke the token. We can
and should avoid adding a new revocation event as growing number
of revocation events causes bad performance in validation.

Change-Id: I7d53320eccd119b9ab394ddc88473d09c9b680b4

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-06-18 21:51:38.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Add api max limit and instance naming parameters

Adds support for the following nova.conf api settings in the
nova::api class:

  DEFAULT/osapi_max_limit
  DEFAULT/osapi_compute_unique_server_name_scope
  DEFAULT/multi_instance_display_name_template

These may be somewhat obscure settings, but I believe in the
philosophy of providing as many config parameters as possible
directly in the classes.  This allows end users to easily take
advantage of automatic data binding with hiera, etc.  Addding
these in yourself with nova::config or nova_config resources
is slightly more effort.

I'm following the de-facto convention of making class parameter
defaults match the config defaults from the upstream service.
This can be refactored to the 'undef as default' paradigm we've
discussed as that gets implemented across the board.  See:
https://etherpad.mozilla.org/liberty-summit-design-puppet-parameter-defaults

Also, I admit that this adds an egregious amount of whitespace
in the class parameters definition and nova_config section.  I'm
not opposed to different formatting, just trying to keep it
consistent.

Change-Id: I676a9fd57e97f735c431a0cdbf41293ddd68c117

commit_message:
Add api max limit and instance naming parameters

Adds support for the following nova.conf api settings in the
nova::api class:

  DEFAULT/osapi_max_limit
  DEFAULT/osapi_compute_unique_server_name_scope
  DEFAULT/multi_instance_display_name_template

These may be somewhat obscure settings, but I believe in the
philosophy of providing as many config parameters as possible
directly in the classes.  This allows end users to easily take
advantage of automatic data binding with hiera, etc.  Addding
these in yourself with nova::config or nova_config resources
is slightly more effort.

I'm following the de-facto convention of making class parameter
defaults match the config defaults from the upstream service.
This can be refactored to the 'undef as default' paradigm we've
discussed as that gets implemented across the board.  See:
https://etherpad.mozilla.org/liberty-summit-design-puppet-parameter-defaults

Also, I admit that this adds an egregious amount of whitespace
in the class parameters definition and nova_config section.  I'm
not opposed to different formatting, just trying to keep it
consistent.

Change-Id: I676a9fd57e97f735c431a0cdbf41293ddd68c117

Now that nova supports the 'auto' stanza, we should just set it all

commit_message:
always set upgrade_level to auto

The partial-ncpu job needed to do a very special dance to set, only on
the partial-ncpu jobs, the upgrade_level, before the new side comes
up.

Now that nova supports the 'auto' stanza, we should just set it all
the time on upgrade. Nodes that get upgraded will know to be auto,
nodes that are not will end up using their normal default latest.

Depends-On: Ieb92f52180369f2513bda40dcbaa9db392816841

Change-Id: I5c899779866ebdf492d474a625eb396273bb0259

The liberty release is not going to have a 'liberty' compatibility tag
in it. This is what you tell a mitaka service to force it to talk
liberty levels. As such, this line was actually just making us fail in
the early smoke testing of the setup grenade environment.

Change-Id: Ieb92f52180369f2513bda40dcbaa9db392816841

In Nova, services talk the latest version of RPC, unless you tell them
otherwise. This can be set with the upgrade_level config option.

You are supposed to set this *before* upgrade, not *before* initial
installation. While this happened to work in the kilo case, it was the
wrong place to do it. Grenade itself will be responsible for setting
this at the correct time in I5c899779866ebdf492d474a625eb396273bb0259

Change-Id: Ieb92f52180369f2513bda40dcbaa9db392816841

commit_message:
grenade-multinode: don't set upgrade level initially

In Nova, services talk the latest version of RPC, unless you tell them
otherwise. This can be set with the upgrade_level config option.

You are supposed to set this *before* upgrade, not *before* initial
installation. While this happened to work in the kilo case, it was the
wrong place to do it. Grenade itself will be responsible for setting
this at the correct time in I5c899779866ebdf492d474a625eb396273bb0259
and devstack-gate should not be in the business of touching this.

Change-Id: Ieb92f52180369f2513bda40dcbaa9db392816841

commit_message:
Pre-stage boot.ipxe into /httpboot

Ironic only deploys the boot.ipxe script when a host is
prepared for deployment. Due to this, test jobs utilizing
a feature such as inspection, cannot boot test nodes.

Change-Id: I67409203f0a01f14c3f3a88cd72c87b960542059

commit_message:
Unlimited option max_resources_per_stack

Since biggest issue for memory problems is nested stack max
resources validation, this patch creates option to remove limit
which skips whole validation whatsoever.

Conflicts:
	heat/engine/resources/stack_resource.py
	heat/tests/engine/test_stack_create.py

Cherry-picked from heat: 601a45d2c9c8d812c841bd47d3abf4a206467fd9
Related-Bug: #1455589
Change-Id: I7c851fcad2d4a41b2f9df42244862b04304812b0

commit_message:
Change assertTrue(isinstance()) by optimal assert

Some of tests use different method of assertTrue(isinstance(A, B)) or
assertEqual(type(A), B). The correct way is to use assertIsInstance(A,
B) provided by testtools.

Change-Id: I2ce6f9afeaf2c55fb781d3ba397cb8f7cbf8b686

subject: Use assert(Not)In instead of assertTrue/False
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 8157, 'name': 'Bertrand LALLAU', 'email': 'bertrand.lallau@gmail.com', 'username': 'blallau'}, {'_account_id': 8410, 'name': 'Richard Theis', 'email': 'rtheis@us.ibm.com', 'username': 'rtheis'}, {'_account_id': 10980, 'name': 'Doug Wiegley', 'email': 'dougwig@parkside.io', 'username': 'dougw'}, {'_account_id': 12403, 'name': 'Al Miller', 'email': 'al.miller@ajmiller.net', 'username': 'ajmiller'}, {'_account_id': 14591, 'name': 'Lubosz Kosnik (diltram)', 'email': 'lubosz.kosnik@intel.com', 'username': 'diltram'}, {'_account_id': 14605, 'name': 'vikram.choudhary', 'email': 'vikschw@gmail.com', 'username': 'vikram.choudhary'}, {'_account_id': 14615, 'name': 'Sergey Belous', 'email': 'belous.py@gmail.com', 'username': 'sbelous'}, {'_account_id': 16237, 'name': 'venkatamahesh', 'email': 'venkatamaheshkotha@gmail.com', 'username': 'venkatamahesh'}, {'_account_id': 17120, 'name': 'Manjeet Singh Bhatia', 'email': 'manjeet.s.bhatia@intel.com', 'username': 'manjeets'}, {'_account_id': 17776, 'name': 'Reedip', 'email': 'reedip.banerjee@gmail.com', 'username': 'Reedip'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-10-08 00:29:42.000000000', 'files': ['neutron_lbaas/tests/unit/db/loadbalancer/test_db_loadbalancer.py', 'neutron_lbaas/tests/unit/drivers/netscaler/test_netscaler_driver_v2.py'], 'message': 'Use assert(Not)In instead of assertTrue/False

Neutron tests should use:

self.assertIn(value, list) and
self.assertNotIn(value, list)

instead of:

self.assertTrue(value in list) and
self.assertFalse(value in list)

because assertIn and assertNotIn raise more meaningful errors:

self.assertIn(3, [1, 2])
>>> MismatchError: 3 not in [1, 2]

self.assertTrue(3 in [1, 2])
>>> AssertionError: False is not true

To enforce this improvement, this patch is created.

commit_message:
Use assert(Not)In instead of assertTrue/False

Neutron tests should use:

self.assertIn(value, list) and
self.assertNotIn(value, list)

instead of:

self.assertTrue(value in list) and
self.assertFalse(value in list)

because assertIn and assertNotIn raise more meaningful errors:

self.assertIn(3, [1, 2])
>>> MismatchError: 3 not in [1, 2]

self.assertTrue(3 in [1, 2])
>>> AssertionError: False is not true

To enforce this improvement, this patch is created.

Change-Id: I4a05ad5a5ff9674dd94cff8b11585fd39dc264b3
Related-Bug: #1218713
